abstract.original_text: A convenient and efficient synthesis of a novel class of acyclic nucleoside phosphonates derived from 2-(phosphonomethoxy)propanoic acid has been developed. The key step of the synthesis is the optimized oxidation of the 3-hydroxy-2-(phosphonomethoxy)propyl (HPMP) analogues to the corresponding 2 0carboxy-PME (CPME) derivatives using the TEMPO/NaClO 2 /NaClO oxidizing system. Although (S)-3-(adenin-9-yl)-2-(phosphonomethoxy)propanoic acid ((S)-CPMEA) has been designed as a compound with potential anti-HIV activity, none of the newly prepared CPME analogues exhibited any antiviral activity.

sentences.segment_text: A convenient and efficient synthesis of a novel class of acyclic nucleoside phosphonates derived from 2 - ( phosphonomethoxy ) propanoic acid has been developed .

The key step of the synthesis is the optimized oxidation of the 3-hydroxy-2 - ( phosphonomethoxy ) propyl ( HPMP ) analogues to the corresponding 2 0carboxy-PME ( CPME ) derivatives using the TEMPO/NaClO 2 / NaClO oxidizing system .
Although ( S ) -3 - ( adenin-9-yl ) -2 - ( phosphonomethoxy ) propanoic acid ( ( S ) - CPMEA ) has been designed as a compound with potential anti-HIV activity ,
none of the newly prepared CPME analogues exhibited any antiviral activity .
